Context:
* Students are required to make a minimum payment before registering for a term.
* Payment due dates and options can be found on student invoices.
* The deposit due date may be earlier than registration dates posted on STU-VIEW.
* Acceptable methods of payment include: online using a credit card, online/telephone banking or in person at the bank, and paying with Aeroplan速 Miles through HigherEdPoints.com.
* Payments made by methods other than credit card must be received by the published due date.
* It takes 3-5 business days for the College to receive payments made by online/telephone banking or at the bank.
* Students can redeem their Aeroplan速 miles through HigherEdPoints.com to offset college costs in $250 increments (1 Aeroplan速 Mile = $0.0008).
* Transfers received from HigherEdPoints.com appear on student accounts within 2-3 business days as a non-refundable cash deposit.
* Payments cannot be made for Aeroplan速 Miles at the front counter or via other payment options.
* Students can view their fees online by logging into STU-VIEW and selecting Financial Services > View Fees.
* Students who did not receive their invoice by email can request one by calling the Contact Centre at (416) 415-2000 or 1-800-265-2002.
* New students are not guaranteed a seat in their program unless they have paid their initial deposit by the due date on their invoice. If the deposit payment is not received by the due date, students will not be able to complete their registration and may lose their seat in the program.
file_path: scraped_pages/otherpages/Frequently Asked Questions about Registration | George Brown College.txt

Context:
* Students need to register for their courses online.
* New students must pay the initial deposit by the due date to hold their seat in the program.
* Returning students also need to pay the initial deposit to register for classes.
* There are two types of programs, Course-Based and Block-Based, with different registration methods.
* Students are responsible for ensuring they are registered for all required courses.
* Assistance with registration can be obtained by calling the Contact Centre at (416) 415-2000 or 1-800-265-2002.
* The text does not apply to Canadian Scholarship Trust Plan, CPP, RESP and USC students.
* Registration start times can be checked on STU-VIEW.
* There are deadlines for opting out of the extended health and dental plan.
file_path: scraped_pages/otherpages/Frequently Asked Questions about Registration | George Brown College.txt

Context:
* Registration start dates and times are posted on STU-VIEW approximately two weeks prior to the start of web registration, with dates and times varying by program and semester.
* The last day to register for a program is the fifth day of the term.
* The last day to add or switch sections in a section-based program, or to withdraw from a course or an entire program with a possible refund is the tenth day of the term.
* The last day to withdraw from a course or an entire program without academic penalty varies depending on the length of the courses.
* Most students can add or drop courses online through STU-VIEW by logging in to their account, selecting Registration Services > Registration > Register for or change/drop courses/sections or withdraw from program, and clicking on the 'Submit Registration' button.
* It is the student's responsibility to ensure that their course registration is accurate after adding or dropping courses.
* In some cases, students may need to seek Academic Advising from their Academic Department before dropping courses.
* Students may add courses to their timetables up until the fifth day of classes, and drop courses up until the Last Day to Drop a Course without Academic Penalty.
* If students cannot register for required courses online or need to add courses that are not available to them online, they will need to contact their Academic Department for assistance. Additional fees may apply in these cases.
* Students can find exact dates on the Important Dates webpage.
file_path: scraped_pages/otherpages/Frequently Asked Questions about Registration | George Brown College.txt

Context:
* Students need to complete their academic department registration and take placement assessments to register for courses.
* Placement tests can be taken online due to COVID-19, with webcam supervision.
* There are no fees charged for placement assessments.
* Students with disabilities who require test accommodations must first register with Accessible Learning Services.
* The Assessment Centre can be contacted at (416) 415-5000 ext. 4565 or 4992.
* Appointment slots fill up quickly, so it's recommended to book placement assessments as soon as possible and through STU-VIEW if possible.
* In-person assessments are not being administered at the Assessment Centre due to COVID-19.
* There is no information about the programs offered by the college in the text.
file_path: scraped_pages/otherpages/Frequently Asked Questions about Registration | George Brown College.txt

Context:
* The Test Accommodation Hotline number is (416) 415-5000 ext. 2624 and the email address is booktest@georgebrown.ca.
* A minimum of 7 days' advance notice is required for accommodation requests.
* Admission assessment results are used to place students in English and/or math courses.
* Students who wrote their admission assessments 6 months or longer before the start of their program and have been placed in foundation-level courses can complete a placement assessment for their program.
* Assessment results take up to 48 hours to be updated on STU-VIEW, students should check again after a day or contact the Assessment Advisor if they still see the message about having to test after 48 hours.
* Placement testing is required for most students entering George Brown College diploma and certificate programs.
* Students who have successfully completed the required college-level courses do not need to take placement assessments again.
* Once registered, students will be able to see exempted courses at the bottom of their time table.
* Students will be automatically placed in foundation-level courses if they do not complete their required placement assessments.
* The text does not contain information about specific programs offered by the college.
file_path: scraped_pages/otherpages/Frequently Asked Questions about Registration | George Brown College.txt

Context:
* The assessment for English and math has a last day to take it, which can be found on the Important Dates webpage.
* Students required to take foundation-level courses will be charged additional fees in semester two.
* More information about the math and English assessments, sample questions, helpful websites, and other resources can be found on the Assessment Centre website.
* Students are encouraged to prepare for their assessment as their course placement depends on the results.
* For more information about placement testing, students can contact the college through various methods.
* The response time for inquiries may take up to 3 business days due to a high volume of inquiries.
* Prior to withdrawing from a program or course, students are encouraged to speak to an academic advisor, counsellor, or faculty member.
* To officially withdraw from a program, students must submit a withdrawal request prior to the published deadline.
* Domestic students must submit a withdrawal request via one of the specified methods.
* The College collects personal information for various purposes and in accordance with the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act.
* Any correspondence from the Registrar's office will be sent to the email address provided to the college.
* Students are encouraged to check their email regularly, particularly at the start and end of terms.
file_path: scraped_pages/otherpages/Frequently Asked Questions about Registration | George Brown College.txt

Context:
Privacy Policy:
- The privacy office can be contacted via email at privacy@georgebrown.ca.
- Student records contain confidential information pertaining to individual students, including name, address, phone number, email address, and date of birth.
- It's important for student record information to be up-to-date.
- For more information, contact the Contact Centre at (416) 415-2000 or 1-800-265-2002.
- Learn more about land acknowledgment and sign up for college news, application deadlines, events, tours, etc. by visiting the website and signing up now.
- Contact information: 416-415-2000, TTY: 1-877-515-5559, ask.george@georgebrown.ca
- Social media hub can be visited for more information.
- The information in the website is subject to change without notice and should not be viewed as a representation, offer or warranty.
- Students are responsible for verifying George Brown College fee requirements.
file_path: scraped_pages/otherpages/Frequently Asked Questions about Registration | George Brown College.txt
